column1: He fallow-deer — This is the domestic or park deer; and no two animals can make a nearer approach to each other than the stag and it
column2: and yet no two animals keep more distinct
column3: or avoid each other with a more inveterate animosity. They never herd or intermix together
column4: and consequently never give rise to an intermediate race; it is even rare
column5: unless they have been transported thither
column6: to find fellow-deer in a country where stags are numerous. He is very easily tamed
column7: and feeds upon many things which the stag refuses: he also browzes closer than the stag
column8: and preserves his venison better. The doe produces one fawn
column11: they resemble the stag in all his natural habits
column12: and the greatest difference between them is the duration of their lives: the stag
column14: lives to the age of thirty-five or forty years
column15: and the fallow-deer does not live more than twenty. As they are smaller than the stag
column16: it is probable that their growth is sooner completed.
